result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Prosecutor, Kerra Stumbris, and Defendant, Terrence P. Wortman, appeared with Attorney Christine Kuczynski.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 28, 2016 at 08:40 am.

Defendant must contact the Clark County Sheriff's Department within 48 hours to schedule and complete at the date and time designated by the Sheriff's Department, the booking process, which includes fingerprinting and photos.

Prosecutor, Kerra Stumbris, and Defendant, Terrence P. Wortman, appeared with Attorney Christine Kuczynski.    Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint.  The defense waived reading of the complaint and stood mute to the charges.  BASED ON THE DEFENDANT STANDING MUTE,THE COURT ENTERED A NOT GUILTY PLEA ON BEHALF OF THE DEFENDANT  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 7, 2016 at 09:00 am.  Status conference scheduled for June 30, 2016 at 08:20 am.
